claims.claim: Intratumoral delivery of an mRNA vaccine creates an interferon-rich inflammatory state.

evidence.quote: intratumoral delivery of an mRNA vaccine can create an interferon-rich inflammatory state
Type I interferon response score (normalized units)

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: mRNA vaccination expands the MHC-I-presented peptide repertoire in tumors.

evidence.quote: A broader peptide repertoire appears on MHC-I, improving tumor visibility to T cells.

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: mRNA vaccination increases PD-L1 pathway activity, making it more targetable.

evidence.quote: PD-L1 pathway activity also increases, creating a rationale for combining with checkpoint blockade.

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: Prior mRNA vaccination is associated with improved survival in ICI-treated cancer patients.

evidence.quote: Vaccinated subgroup had improved survival under ICI treatment
aligns with better outcomes in the retrospective human cohort

claims.caveat: The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; residual confounding is likely.
